channel.title: Suggestion: make alch unable to heal butler's poision
channel.description:
Right now, BD have no way to kill an evil king. Executing him after day 4 is way too late, because those are the days you have to start finding the MM. prince, knights, hunter can't kill him, and butler poision can't do anything because alchs always loyal to the king.
I suggest that only physician will be able to heal the king from butler poision.
I think its important because right now evil kings win like 70-80% of the games IMO, And they lose only if they get reaped early or play extremly bad.

item.title: Suggestion: make alch unable to heal butler's poision
item.dc:creator: Aquillion
item.description:
Absolutely not; this is a completely awful suggestion. Alchemists are vital because they provide a neutral that the king has a reason to want to keep alive; taking away their ability to heal kings would make them even more execute-on-sight, and encouraging an execute-on-sight mentality defeats the entire purpose of having non-evil neutral roles like that. Giving a neutral or evil king in particular a reason to keep Alchemists alive is good for the game, and making it have a big impact on how things go adds strategic depth.

Beyond that, the BD should generally lynch the king if he’s evil. If they’ve reached the late game (and therefore don’t have enough of a majority to do it), and the Alchemist is still alive, and they’re depending on the Butler to save them… well, they’ve screwed up and deserve to lose. BDs need to pressure unhelpful kings more aggressively.

I get that you’re pissed about the high impact that evil kings have, but butler poison isn’t a solution, and nerfing Alchemists isn’t going to help. If you feel the king is too powerful, nerf the king, don’t make the interactions surrounding him more simplistic and boring. Alchemists being able to heal kings is interesting and adds depth to the game.

Think before you suggest things. Think about all the various ways mechanics are interconnected and how they will influence each other if changed. Don’t just randomly hammer unrelated stuff in order to hurt or help one role in particular. If you think evil kings are overpowered, the answer is obviously to tweak the specific powers that make kings so powerful (like Allies), not to break a major aspect of alchemists.

(I’m also very much not convinced that evil kings are powerful at all. Obviously an evil king helps evils, but in practice the impact is blunted by the fact that they don’t know the king is on their side, while the king doesn’t know his allies. In my experience, evil kings often end up ineffectual rather than carrying the game - they have a big impact, but it’s mostly by denying the BD the absolutely massive benefits of an active and aggressive BD king, not by doing anything particularly important themselves. Or, in other words, the issue isn’t that evil kings are overpowered, it’s that BD kings are overpowered and that losing this advantage therefore hurts the BD a lot. Whether the king gets poisoned or not makes no difference - you’re focusing on the wrong thing.)
